summary: The document comprises a memorandum and related letters detailing a Letter of Indemnity for Collins Radio, outlining an agreement for research and development work on behalf of an Agency proprietary. It includes guarantees by the Agency for agreements between Collins Radio and the proprietary, featuring both classified and unclassified communications. The classified letter specifically acknowledges a Liechtenstein entity as an instrumentality of the U.S. Government, with the Agency ensuring its agreements and credit, highlighting the national security relevance.
key_findings: The document reveals a confidential agreement between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and Collins Radio for research and development work.
It highlights the use of a Liechtenstein entity, Anstalt Electronic Products International Etablissement, as an instrumentality of the U.S. Government.
The CIA guarantees all agreements and credit of the Liechtenstein entity, underlining the national security implications.
The document includes both classified and unclassified communications, showing a level of secrecy and protocol in handling sensitive information.
keywords: Liechtenstein Anstalt Electronic Products International Etablissement
instrumentality of the United States Government
